LOCAL TITLE: INSTRUCTIONS AND PATIENT DECISION AIDS DATE OF NOTE: DEC 5,2016@13:10 ENTRY DATE: DEC 5,2016@13:11:36 AUTHOR: SEVEN,HENRYEXP COSIGNER: URGENCY:STATUS: COMPLETED
a. Diet: Diabetic low salt diet b. Medications: Take prescribed medications as advised. c. Appointments: Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week. Follow up with Outpatient facility for Immunosuppression treatement. d. For Fever > 101.5 F, or onset of chest pain/breathlessness contact Emergency.
/es/ HENRY SEVEN
Signed: 12/05/2016 13:14

LOCAL TITLE: GOALS DATE OF NOTE: DEC 6,2016@14:52 ENTRY DATE: DEC 6,2016@14:53:08 AUTHOR: SEVEN,HENRYEXP COSIGNER: URGENCY:STATUS: COMPLETED
Need to gain more energy to do regular activities.
Negotiated Goal to keep Body Temperature at 98-99 degrees Fahrenheit with regular monitoring.
/es/ HENRY SEVEN
Signed: 12/06/2016 14:54

LOCAL TITLE: FUTURE APPOINTMENTS & REFERRALS DATE OF NOTE: DEC 7,2016@07:31 ENTRY DATE: DEC 7,2016@07:31:36 AUTHOR: SEVEN,HENRYEXP COSIGNER: URGENCY:STATUS: COMPLETED

LOCAL TITLE: ASSESSMENT DATE OF NOTE: DEC 6,2016@14:48 ENTRY DATE: DEC 6,2016@14:49:07 AUTHOR: SEVEN,HENRYEXP COSIGNER: URGENCY:STATUS: COMPLETED
The patient was found to have Anemia and Dr Seven and his staff diagnosed the condition and treated Ms Rebecca for Anemia during the 2 day stay at Community Health Hospitals. Ms Rebecca recovered from Anemia during the stay and is being discharged in a stable condition. If there is fever greater than 101.5 F or onset of chest pain/breathlessness the patient is advised to contact emergency.
/es/ HENRY SEVEN
Signed: 12/06/2016 14:51

LOCAL TITLE: HEALTH CONCERNS DATE OF NOTE: DEC 12,2016@10:37ENTRY DATE: DEC 12,2016@10:38:07 AUTHOR: SEVEN,HENRYEXP COSIGNER: URGENCY:STATUS: COMPLETED
a. Chronic Sickness exhibited by patient b. HealthCare Concerns refer to underlying clinical facts i. Documented HyperTension problem ii. Documented HypoThyroidism problem iii. Watch Weight of patient iv. Documented Anemia problem
/es/ HENRY SEVEN
Signed: 12/12/2016 10:40
